node.title: Perth loses fifth Ashes Test due to WA quarantine rules, no decision on replacement venue
node.alt: A general view of Perth Stadium during a 2019 BBL match.
node.description: Cricket AustraliaÂ confirms that the fifth and final Ashes Test will not be held at Perth Stadium, following the WA government's requirement for all players, staff and broadcasters to quarantine for 14 days after arriving in the state.
node.content: ["The fifth and final Ashes Test will not be played in Perth after Cricket Australia\u00a0decided to move the match due to Western Australia's COVID-19 restrictions.", "Australia and England were hoping the Western Australian government would give exemptions for players and staff to avoid lengthy quarantines, but they faced a 14-day stint on arriving in Perth.", "The final match in the series, which is due to begin on January 14, will now be held at a new venue yet to be announced.", "More to come."]
